content: Déjà vu, we call it. When your eyes are telling you one thing yet your sensations are telling you another: “I’ve been here before.” That’s so creepy that it can lead people to rationalize the sensation of familiarity as the memory of a past life. But no. Déjà vu is a failure to separate, a failure of the brain to make sure a new memory isn’t interfering with an old one.
